required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, and Efficacy of Odanacatib (MK-0822) in Postmenopausal Women Previously Treated With a Bisphosphonate (MK-0822-042)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase IIa Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo Controlled Study to Evaluate the Effects of Odanacatib (MK-0822) on Bone Mineral Density (BMD) and Overall Safety in the Treatment of Osteoporosis in Postmenopausal Women Previously Treated With Alendronate

brief_summary.textblock: The study will evaluate the both the efficacy of odanacatib on Bone Mineral Density (BMD) and the safety of odanacatib for postmenopausal osteoporosis in patients previously treated with alendronate. The primary hypothesis of the trial is that treatment with odanacatib 50 mg once weekly will increase bone mineral density at the femoral neck compared to placebo at the end of 24 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Femoral Neck Bone Mineral Density (BMD) at Month 24
primary_outcome.description: BMD at the femoral neck was assessed by dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry (DXA) at baseline and Month 24.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Experiencing One or More Adverse Events (AEs)
primary_outcome.description: An AE was defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign including an abnormal laboratory finding, symptom or disease associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, regardless of whether it was considered related to the medical treatment or procedure, that occurred during the course of the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Discontinuing Study Drug Due to an AE
primary_outcome.description: An AE was defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign including an abnormal laboratory finding, symptom or disease associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, regardless of whether it was considered related to the medical treatment or procedure, that occurred during the course of the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Femoral Neck BMD at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: BMD at the femoral neck was assessed by DXA at baseline and Month 12.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Trochanter BMD at Month 24
secondary_outcome.description: BMD at the trochanter was assessed by DXA at baseline and Month 24.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Trochanter BMD at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: BMD at the trochanter was assessed by DXA at baseline and Month 12.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Total Hip BMD at Month 24
secondary_outcome.description: BMD at the total hip was assessed by DXA at baseline and Month 24.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Total Hip BMD at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: BMD at the total hip was assessed by DXA at baseline and Month 12.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Lumbar Spine BMD at Month 24
secondary_outcome.description: BMD at the lumbar spine was assessed by DXA at baseline and Month 24.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Lumbar Spine BMD at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: BMD at the lumbar spine was assessed by DXA at baseline and Month 12.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in 1/3 Distal Forearm BMD at Month 24
secondary_outcome.description: BMD at the 1/3 distal forearm was assessed by DXA at baseline and Month 24.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in 1/3 Distal Forearm BMD at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: BMD at the 1/3 distal forearm was assessed by DXA at baseline and Month 12.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Log-Transformed Serum C-Telopeptides of Type I Collagen (s-CTx) at Month 24
secondary_outcome.description: s-CTx is a biochemical marker of bone resorption.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Log-Transformed s-CTx at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: s-CTx is a biochemical marker of bone resorption.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Log-Transformed Urine N-Telopeptides/Creatinine Ratio at Month 24
secondary_outcome.description: N-Telopeptides of Type 1 Collagen to Urine Creatinine Ratio (u-NTx/Cr) is a biochemical marker of bone resorption.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Log-Transformed u-NTx/Cr at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: u-NTx/Cr is a biochemical marker of bone resorption.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Log-Transformed Serum Bone-Specific Alkaline Phosphatase at Month 24
secondary_outcome.description: Bone-Specific Alkaline Phosphatase (BSAP) is a biochemical marker of bone formation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Log-Transformed Serum BSAP at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: BSAP is a biochemical marker of bone formation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Log-Transformed Serum N-Terminal Propeptide of Type I Collagen at Month 24
secondary_outcome.description: Serum N-terminal propeptide of Type I collagen (s-P1NP) is a biochemical marker of bone formation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Log-Transformed Serum N-terminal Propeptide of Type I Collagen at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: s-P1NP is a biochemical marker of bone formation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Log-Transformed Serum Calcium at Month 24
secondary_outcome.description: Serum calcium is an index of calcium homeostasis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Log-Transformed Serum Phosphate at Month 24
secondary_outcome.description: Serum phosphate is an index of mineral homeostasis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Log-Transformed Serum Parathyroid Hormone at Month 24
secondary_outcome.description: Serum parathyroid hormone (SPH) regulates calcium, phosphorus, and vitamin D levels in the blood.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Log-Transformed Serum 1,25 Dihydroxyvitamin D at Month 24
secondary_outcome.description: 1,25 dihydroxyvitamin D [1,25(OH)2 D] is the active vitamin D metabolite and stimulates calcium absorption in the intestine.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Log-Transformed Serum 25-Hydroxyvitamin D at Month 24
secondary_outcome.description: The 25-hydroxy vitamin D [25(OH)D] test is the most accurate way to measure vitamin D. In the kidney, 25-hydroxy vitamin D is converted into 1,25 di-hydroxyvitamin D, the active vitamin D metabolite.

arm_group.description: Odanacatib 50 mg tablets once weekly for 24 months. Vitamin D3 (dietary supplement), two 2800 IU tablets, taken once weekly for 24 months. Participants received calcium carbonate supplements as needed to ensure a daily calcium intake of 1200 mg.

Placebo to odanacatib 50 mg tablets once weekly for 24 months. Vitamin D3 (dietary supplement), two 2800 IU tablets, taken once weekly for 24 months. Participants received calcium carbonate supplements as needed to ensure a daily calcium intake of 1200 mg.

intervention.description: Odanacatib 50 mg tablets once weekly for 24 months
Placebo to odanacatib 50 mg tablets once weekly for 24 months
Vitamin D3, two 2800 IU tablets, taken once weekly for 24 months
Participants will receive calcium carbonate supplements as needed to ensure a daily calcium intake of 1200 mg.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Has been postmenopausal for at least 5 years
- Has taken or is taking alendronate
- Agrees not to use medications for osteoporosis other than what is provided by the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Has a history or evidence of hip fracture
- Has a history of cancer within 5 years of screening, except certain skin or cervical cancers.
- Has active parathyroid disease
- Has a history of thyroid disease not adequately controlled by medication
- Is taking anti-seizure medication and has abnormal calcium metabolism
- Has received any bisphosphonate other than alendronate for 20% of the last 3 years, or within 3 months of screening

results_reference.citation: Bonnick S, De Villiers T, Odio A, Palacios S, Chapurlat R, DaSilva C, Scott BB, Le Bailly De Tilleghem C, Leung AT, Gurner D. Effects of odanacatib on BMD and safety in the treatment of osteoporosis in postmenopausal women previously treated with alendronate: a randomized placebo-controlled trial. J Clin Endocrinol Metab. 2013 Dec;98(12):4727-35. doi: 10.1210/jc.2013-2020. Epub 2013 Sep 24.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were enrolled and treated in 40 study centers located in the United States, Europe, South Africa, and Asia-Pacific.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Women â‰¥ 60 years of age who had been on, or were on, an alendronate therapy for postmenopausal osteoporosis were eligible to participate in this trial.

group.title: Odanacatib 50 mg
group.description: Odanacatib 50 mg tablets once weekly for 24 months. Vitamin D3 (dietary supplement), two 2800 IU tablets, taken once weekly for 24 months. Participants received calcium carbonate supplements as needed to ensure a daily calcium intake of approximately 1200 mg.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo to odanacatib 50 mg tablets once weekly for 24 months. Vitamin D3 (dietary supplement), two 2800 IU tablets, taken once weekly for 24 months. Participants received calcium carbonate supplements as needed to ensure a daily calcium intake of approximately 1200 mg.

baseline.population: The baseline characteristics are displayed for the All-Participants-As-Treated Population.

group.description: Placebo to odanacatib 50 mg tablets once weekly for 24 months. Vitamin D3 (dietary supplement), two 2800 IU tablets, taken once weekly for 24 months. Participants received calcium carbonate supplements as needed to ensure a daily calcium intake of approximately 1200 mg.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Sex: Female, Male
Baseline DEXA Areal Bone Mineral Density T-score
measure.description: Dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry (DEXA), Bone Mineral Density (BMD), T-score. T-Score is the difference between the BMD value and the average bone mass for sex-matched, healthy young adults; the difference being expressed in number of standard deviations; T-score based upon the normative database in use by the manufactures. A T-score of -1.0 or above is considered normal. More negative numbers are more indicative of osteoporosis.

measure.title: Baseline Biochemical Markers of Bone Resorption and Bone Formation
Urine N-Telopeptides/Creatinine Ratio
measure.description: u-NTx/Cr (nmol/mmol), Odanacatib 50 mg N=115, Placebo N=114, Total N=229

outcome.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Femoral Neck Bone Mineral Density (BMD) at Month 24
outcome.description: BMD at the femoral neck was assessed by dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry (DXA) at baseline and Month 24.
outcome.population: The population analyzed included all randomized, treated participants who had femoral neck BMD data at Baseline and Month 24.

group.title: Odanacatib 50 mg
group.description: Odanacatib 50 mg tablets once weekly for 24 months. Vitamin D3 (dietary supplement), two 2800 IU tablets, taken once weekly for 24 months. Participants received calcium carbonate supplements as needed to ensure a daily calcium intake of approximately 1200 mg.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo to odanacatib 50 mg tablets once weekly for 24 months. Vitamin D3 (dietary supplement), two 2800 IU tablets, taken once weekly for 24 months. Participants received calcium carbonate supplements as needed to ensure a daily calcium intake of approximately 1200 mg.

measure.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Femoral Neck Bone Mineral Density (BMD) at Month 24
measure.description: BMD at the femoral neck was assessed by dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry (DXA) at baseline and Month 24.
measure.population: The population analyzed included all randomized, treated participants who had femoral neck BMD data at Baseline and Month 24.

analysis.groups_desc: The primary hypothesis of the study was met if; in postmenopausal women previously treated with alendronate with low BMD, two years of treatment with odanacatib 50 mg significantly increased BMD at the femoral neck site compared to placebo (p-value < 0.001).
analysis.param_type: Difference in the Least Squares Means
analysis.estimate_desc: Baseline measurement and post-baseline percent changes from baseline, with fixed effects for treatment, time, duration of prior alendronate use (3-5 years, >5 years), geographic region, machine type (Lunar/Hologic) and treatment-by-time interaction

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Experiencing One or More Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.description: An AE was defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign including an abnormal laboratory finding, symptom or disease associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, regardless of whether it was considered related to the medical treatment or procedure, that occurred during the course of the study.
outcome.population: The population analyzed included all participants who took at least one dose of study medication and were counted in the treatment group of the medication they actually took.

outcome.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Log-Transformed Serum C-Telopeptides of Type I Collagen (s-CTx) at Month 24
outcome.description: s-CTx is a biochemical marker of bone resorption.
outcome.population: The population analyzed included all randomized, treated participants who had s-CTx data at Baseline and Month 24 but excluded participants due to important protocol deviations that may have substantially affected the results such as use of concomitant medication, lack of study medication compliance, and medical history.

measure.population: The population analyzed included all randomized, treated participants who had s-CTx data at Baseline and Month 12 but excluded participants due to important protocol deviations that may have substantially affected the results such as use of concomitant medication, lack of study medication compliance, and medical history.

analysis.param_type: Difference in the Least Squares Means
analysis.estimate_desc: Log-transformed baseline and post-baseline measurements up to Month 24, with fixed effects for treatment, time, duration of prior alendronate use, geographical region, the interaction of time-by-treatment and the time-by-factor interactions.

outcome.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Log-Transformed Urine N-Telopeptides/Creatinine Ratio at Month 24
outcome.description: N-Telopeptides of Type 1 Collagen to Urine Creatinine Ratio (u-NTx/Cr) is a biochemical marker of bone resorption.
outcome.population: The population analyzed included all randomized, treated participants who had u-NTx/Cr data at Baseline and Month 24 but excluded participants due to important protocol deviations that may have substantially affected the results such as use of concomitant medication, lack of study medication compliance, and medical history.

group.title: Odanacatib 50 mg
group.description: Odanacatib 50 mg tablets once weekly for 24 months. Vitamin D3 (dietary supplement), two 2800 IU tablets, taken once weekly for 24 months. Participants received calcium carbonate supplements as needed to ensure a daily calcium intake of approximately 1200 mg.

group.description: Placebo to odanacatib 50 mg tablets once weekly for 24 months. Vitamin D3 (dietary supplement), two 2800 IU tablets, taken once weekly for 24 months. Participants received calcium carbonate supplements as needed to ensure a daily calcium intake of approximately 1200 mg.

outcome.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Log-Transformed Serum Parathyroid Hormone at Month 24
outcome.description: Serum parathyroid hormone (SPH) regulates calcium, phosphorus, and vitamin D levels in the blood.
outcome.population: The population analyzed included all randomized, treated participants who had SPH data at Baseline and Month 24 but excluded participants due to important protocol deviations that may have substantially affected the results such as use of concomitant medication, lack of study medication compliance, and medical history.

outcome.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Log-Transformed Serum 1,25 Dihydroxyvitamin D at Month 24
outcome.description: 1,25 dihydroxyvitamin D [1,25(OH)2 D] is the active vitamin D metabolite and stimulates calcium absorption in the intestine.
outcome.population: The population analyzed included all randomized, treated participants who had 1,25(OH)2 D data at Baseline and Month 24 but excluded participants due to important protocol deviations that may have substantially affected the results such as use of concomitant medication, lack of study medication compliance, and medical history.

group.title: Odanacatib 50 mg
group.description: Odanacatib 50 mg tablets once weekly for 24 months. Vitamin D3 (dietary supplement), two 2800 IU tablets, taken once weekly for 24 months. Participants received calcium carbonate supplements as needed to ensure a daily calcium intake of approximately 1200 mg.

measure.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Log-Transformed Serum 1,25 Dihydroxyvitamin D at Month 24
measure.description: 1,25 dihydroxyvitamin D [1,25(OH)2 D] is the active vitamin D metabolite and stimulates calcium absorption in the intestine.
measure.population: The population analyzed included all randomized, treated participants who had 1,25(OH)2 D data at Baseline and Month 24 but excluded participants due to important protocol deviations that may have substantially affected the results such as use of concomitant medication, lack of study medication compliance, and medical history.

analysis.param_type: Difference in the Least Squares Means
analysis.estimate_desc: Log-transformed baseline and post-baseline measurements up to Month 24, with fixed effects for treatment, time, duration of prior alendronate use, geographical region, the interaction of time-by-treatment and the time-by-factor interactions.

outcome.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Log-Transformed Serum 25-Hydroxyvitamin D at Month 24
outcome.description: The 25-hydroxy vitamin D [25(OH)D] test is the most accurate way to measure vitamin D. In the kidney, 25-hydroxy vitamin D is converted into 1,25 di-hydroxyvitamin D, the active vitamin D metabolite.
outcome.population: The population analyzed included all randomized, treated participants who had 25(OH)D data at Baseline and Month 24 but excluded participants due to important protocol deviations that may have substantially affected the results such as use of concomitant medication, lack of study medication compliance, and medical history.

group.title: Odanacatib 50 mg
group.description: Odanacatib 50 mg tablets once weekly for 24 months. Vitamin D3 (dietary supplement), two 2800 IU tablets, taken once weekly for 24 months. Participants received calcium carbonate supplements as needed to ensure a daily calcium intake of approximately 1200 mg.

measure.title: Percent Change From Baseline in Log-Transformed Serum 25-Hydroxyvitamin D at Month 24
measure.description: The 25-hydroxy vitamin D [25(OH)D] test is the most accurate way to measure vitamin D. In the kidney, 25-hydroxy vitamin D is converted into 1,25 di-hydroxyvitamin D, the active vitamin D metabolite.
measure.population: The population analyzed included all randomized, treated participants who had 25(OH)D data at Baseline and Month 24 but excluded participants due to important protocol deviations that may have substantially affected the results such as use of concomitant medication, lack of study medication compliance, and medical history.

analysis.estimate_desc: Log-transformed baseline and post-baseline measurements up to Month 24, with fixed effects for treatment, time, duration of prior alendronate use, geographical region, the interaction of time-by-treatment and the time-by-factor interactions.

reported_events.desc: The APaT population included all participants who took at least one dose of study medication and were counted in the treatment group of the medication they actually took.

group.title: Odanacatib 50 mg
group.description: Odanacatib 50 mg tablets once weekly for 24 months. Vitamin D3 (dietary supplement), two 2800 IU tablets, taken once weekly for 24 months. Participants received calcium carbonate supplements as needed to ensure a daily calcium intake of approximately 1200 mg.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The sponsor must have the opportunity to review all proposed abstracts, manuscripts, or presentations regarding this study 60 days prior to submission for publication/presentation. Any information identified by the sponsor as confidential must be deleted prior to submission.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
